***

# `r emo::ji("spiral_notepad")` Reminders of each capping and formula:  

Creatinine data are capped as :  
- creat < 0.7 was set at 0.7  
- creat > 3 are eliminated  

CrCl calculation :

$$CrCl = \frac{(140 - ageatdx) * weight\_closest\_to\_cycle}{72 * creatinine\_closest\_to\_cycle} * 0.85$$
and is capped at 125.  
<br>


Calculating more BSA values :
$$bsa\_du\_bois = 0.007184 * (height*100)^{0.725} * weight^{0.425}$$
<br>

I clean the data up by keeping the `relativeorderedamount`:  
- >= 50 & <= 175 for taxel and cisplatin  and with a unit in `mg/m2`  
- >= 2  & <= 6   for platin and with a unit in `AUC`

<br>

`expected_dose` is:  
-`target_auc` * (`CrCl` + 25)   -> for `drugname` == "carboplatin"  
-`BSA` * `target_auc`           -> for `drugname` == "taxel" or "cisplatin"  
(Again keep in mind that `target_auc` is just the name of the column in the data but is calculated differently depending of the drug name)  
It was capped to 900 when was > 900 for a `target_auc` of 6 and to 750 when was > 750 for a `target_auc` of 5 (Carboplatin). 

<br>

Then I calculate $$relative\ dose\ intensity\ (RDI) = \frac{amount\ given}{expected\ dose}$$

<br>

<span style="color:red">**Please confirm everything is correct**</span>

# I. Drug episode cleaning

- Select episodedatasource == "Administrations"

- Combine multiple administrations of the same drug at the same date
Flatiron says:
There are a small number of patients with multiple records in the MedicationAdministration table for the same drug on the same day. We reviewed several instances where this occurs in the original EMR records and found, in each case, legitimate clinical reasons substantiating the multiple administrations per day. Although these instances were legitimate medication administrations, Flatiron Health data are generated from real-world clinical practice and are subject to miscoding and errors by the clinical oncology team, as are all EMR data. Below are three patient vignettes taken from our review of EMR notes, illustrating the variety of reasons why this may occur.  
For clinical reasons, a patient was given higher than normal dose which was listed as two administrations of the normal dose.  
Three administrations of the same drug were listed on a Friday. The EMR note stated that one dose was administered in the office and the patient was sent home with the two remaining doses for the weekend.   
Patient had an allergic reaction in the past and was administered multiple smaller doses in the same day as part of a desensitization protocol.

<br>

- Bind everything together to calculate target auc/target dose and expected dose

(hold on to the thought that what I call `target_auc` include the target AUC calculated for Carboplatin and target dose calculated for cisplatin and paclitaxel, they are just present in the same column called `target_auc` for a tidy data organization - You can find the calculations formula at the end of the document)  
When I bind the data together (drug + corresponding creatinine + ...), I take the closest date of creatinine, height, weight, BSA, AUC, from the cycle date to calculate `target_auc` for Carboplatin, and paclitaxel and their `expected_dose`. It can be days in between but it can also be more. 

`r emo::ji("check")`  
We decided to take the creatinine, weight, bsa measured within a month of the cycle start date AND before surgery when Neoadjuvant line, after surgery but before end of line when Adjuvant line

```{r RDI calculation}
Treatment <- Treatment %>% 
  # filter(chemotherapy_type == "Neoadjuvant" |
  #          (chemotherapy_type == "Adjuvant" &
  #             linenumber_adj == 1)) %>%

  mutate(relative_dose_intensity = amount / expected_dose # adjusted_expected_dose
  ) %>%
  # select(patientid,linenumber, linenumber_new, chemotherapy_type, drugname_type, drugname,
  #        relative_dose_intensity, linenumber_adj) %>%
  
  # Average RDI by drug by line (will NOT combine pacli-doce and cis-carbo-oxalo)
  group_by(patientid, chemotherapy_type, drugname) %>%
  # mutate(mean_RDI_per_drug = case_when(
  #   chemotherapy_type == "Adjuvant" &
  #     linenumber_adj == 1                  ~ round(mean(relative_dose_intensity, na.rm = TRUE), 3),
  #   chemotherapy_type == "Neoadjuvant"     ~ round(mean(relative_dose_intensity, na.rm = TRUE), 3)
  # )) %>% 
  mutate(mean_RDI_per_drug = round(mean(relative_dose_intensity, na.rm = TRUE), 3)
  ) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(mean_RDI_per_drug = na_if(mean_RDI_per_drug, "NaN"))

RDI_data <- Treatment %>% 
  distinct(patientid, chemotherapy_type, drugname, .keep_all = TRUE)
```

```{r RDI calculation group}
RDI_data <- RDI_data %>% 
  # general
  mutate(RDI_grp = case_when(
    mean_RDI_per_drug >= 0.85              ~ "Adequate dosing",
    mean_RDI_per_drug < 0.85               ~ "Underdosed"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_grp = factor(RDI_grp, 
                           levels = c("Adequate dosing", "Underdosed"))) %>% 
  # separated
  mutate(RDI_carbo_neo = case_when(
    drugname == "carboplatin" &
      chemotherapy_type == "Neoadjuvant"    ~ mean_RDI_per_drug,
    TRUE                                    ~ NA_real_
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_pacli_neo = case_when(
    drugname == "paclitaxel" &
      chemotherapy_type == "Neoadjuvant"    ~ mean_RDI_per_drug,
    TRUE                                    ~ NA_real_
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_carbo_adj = case_when(
    drugname == "carboplatin" &
      chemotherapy_type == "Adjuvant"    ~ mean_RDI_per_drug,
    TRUE                                    ~ NA_real_
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_pacli_adj = case_when(
    drugname == "paclitaxel" &
      chemotherapy_type == "Adjuvant"    ~ mean_RDI_per_drug,
    TRUE                                    ~ NA_real_
  )) %>% 
  
  mutate(RDI_carbo_neo_grp = case_when(
    RDI_carbo_neo >= 0.85              ~ "Adequate dosing",
    RDI_carbo_neo < 0.85               ~ "Underdosed"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_carbo_neo_grp = factor(RDI_carbo_neo_grp, 
                           levels = c("Adequate dosing", "Underdosed"))) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_pacli_neo_grp = case_when(
    RDI_pacli_neo >= 0.85              ~ "Adequate dosing",
    RDI_pacli_neo < 0.85               ~ "Underdosed"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_pacli_neo_grp = factor(RDI_pacli_neo_grp, 
                           levels = c("Adequate dosing", "Underdosed"))) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_carbo_adj_grp = case_when(
    RDI_carbo_adj >= 0.85              ~ "Adequate dosing",
    RDI_carbo_adj < 0.85               ~ "Underdosed"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_carbo_adj_grp = factor(RDI_carbo_adj_grp, 
                           levels = c("Adequate dosing", "Underdosed"))) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_pacli_adj_grp = case_when(
    RDI_pacli_adj >= 0.85              ~ "Adequate dosing",
    RDI_pacli_adj < 0.85               ~ "Underdosed"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(RDI_pacli_adj_grp = factor(RDI_pacli_adj_grp, 
                           levels = c("Adequate dosing", "Underdosed")))
RDI_data %>% distinct(patientid) %>% nrow()
```

```{r RDI_data}
RDI_data <- RDI_data %>% 
  group_by(patientid) %>% 
  fill(RDI_carbo_neo, RDI_carbo_neo_grp, 
       RDI_pacli_neo, RDI_pacli_neo_grp, 
       RDI_carbo_adj, RDI_carbo_adj_grp, 
       RDI_pacli_adj, RDI_pacli_adj_grp, 
       .direction = "downup") %>% 
  ungroup()
RDI_data_per_patients <- RDI_data %>% 
  mutate(carbo_arrange_variable = case_when(
    drugname == "carboplatin"           ~ 1
  )) %>% 
  arrange(carbo_arrange_variable) %>% 
  distinct(patientid, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% 
  select(-c(linename, linenumber, linenumber_adj, 
            linenumber_new, linestartdate, lineenddate,
            cycle_drugname, cycle_increment, cycle_start_date,
            cycle_count_perline, cycle_major_drugname))
```

## 1. step 1: Flatiron recommendation cleanup

This step is to remove patients from the population that don't follow flatiron recommendations.  

- 90 days rule between diagnosis and treatment  
Flatiron propose a conceptual instruction on the 90-day-gap : 90 days between diagnosis and treatment.  
It is meant to exclude patients who didn't get treatment for 90 days which would most likely mean that some treatment data are missing. Patients left after this step:

- 30 days rule excluding patient who didn't survive for at least 30 days after diagnosis  
This is something that Flatiron strongly recommends, but does not require. Flatiron proposal reviewers will likely provide comments on this if not incorporated into a proposal. 

- Exclude exclude == "1" coded by Lauren

Are excluded :  
-	Data from one PracticeID  (Flatiron requested removal of this practice ID from the dataset)  
-	Certain historical structured data were not available for patients seen at academic sites prior to 2015 – Flatiron has asked that if conducting survival analyses, these patients are removed (patients diagnosed < 2015 at academic sites)  
```{r flatiron_rec}
flatiron_rec <- RDI_data_per_patients %>% 
  filter(is.na(flatiron_rules))
```

**At the end of the step 1, we have `r flatiron_rec %>% distinct(patientid) %>% nrow()` patients.** 

<br>

## 2. step 2: Filter patients with clinical characteristics fitting to the study criteria

-	exclude borderline cases (not invasive ovarian cancer)  
- exclude patients whose histology is unknown  
- remove chemotherapy only patients  
- include only patients who received platin and/or taxane (exclude patients who didn't received carboplatin)  
- exclude patients who only received neo + surgery  
- include patients with single or dual P/T +/- Bev as frontline treatment
```{r study_criteria}
study_criteria <- flatiron_rec %>% 
  filter(is.na(borderline))

study_criteria <- study_criteria %>% 
  filter(!is.na(histology)) # %>% 
  # filter(histology == "Serous") 
  # filter(histology == "Others")

study_criteria <- study_criteria %>%
  filter(!is.na(surgerydate)) %>% 
  mutate(chemotherapy_type = factor(chemotherapy_type))

study_criteria <- study_criteria %>%
  filter(had_carbo == "Yes")

study_criteria <- study_criteria %>% 
  filter(treatment_sequence == "neo + surg + adj" |
           treatment_sequence == "surg + adj")

study_criteria <- study_criteria %>%
  filter(is.na(line_keep))
```

**At the end of the step 2, we have `r study_criteria %>% distinct(patientid) %>% nrow()` patients.** 

<br>

## 3. step 3: Filter out patients with missing data

- exclude the patients who had surgery but we don't have a date of surgery -> NONE removed anymore  
- remove patients with long gap between surgery and adjuvant start (3  months) -> NONE removed anymore  
- exclude patients with a date of drug or date of surgery BEFORE diagnosis will be excluded (inclined to be wrongly recorded)
- exclude patients for whose no RDI were available FOR CARBOPLATIN

```{r missing_data}
missing_data <- study_criteria %>% 
  filter(!(issurgery == "Yes" & is.na(surgerydate))) 

missing_data <- missing_data %>%
  filter(is.na(gap_surg_drugs))

missing_data <- missing_data %>% 
  filter(days_at_first_drug >= 0 &
           (is.na(surgerydate) | days_at_surg >= 0)
         )

missing_data <- missing_data %>% 
  # remove these patients who switched C > C 
  filter((
    therapy == "Upfront Chemo" &
      (!is.na(RDI_carbo_neo) & 
         !is.na(RDI_carbo_adj)) 
  ) | (
    therapy == "Upfront Surgery" &
      (!is.na(RDI_carbo_adj))
  )
  )
```
**At the end of the step 3, we have `r missing_data %>% distinct(patientid) %>% nrow()` patients.** 

## 4. step 4: Include patients with treatments following the standard of clinical care

- exclude patients with other than intravenous drugs
- exclude patients with more than 1 line as Neo
- exclude patients with maintenance within their frontline
- exclude patients with more than 6 cycles in Neo, more than 9 cycles **total** in upfront chemo or more than 9 cycles in upfront surgery
- Exclude patients that received wrong dose dense of 1 carbo + 2 paclitaxel
- exclude patients who switch drug within a line
```{r standard_care}
standard_care <- missing_data %>% 
  # Remove patients with more than 1 line as Neo
  filter(is.na(neo_more_more_than_1line)) %>% 
  filter(is.na(intravenous_rule))

standard_care <- standard_care %>% 
  filter(is.na(frontline_has_maintenance))

standard_care <- standard_care %>% 
  filter(is.na(too_many_cycle))

standard_care <- standard_care %>% 
  filter(is.na(wrong_pacli_dosedense))

Frontline <- standard_care %>%
  filter(is.na(switch_drugs))
```

Imputation for stagecat and debulking status

https://bookdown.org/mwheymans/bookmi/data-analysis-after-multiple-imputation.html#data-analysis-in-spss
https://www.ebpi.uzh.ch/dam/jcr:dc0cef17-29c7-4e61-8d33-e690561ab7ae/mi_intro20191001.pdf

Select the variables that may be important for predicting stagecat and debulking status:  
patientid, month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status, raceeth, ageatdx, stagecat, debulking, histology, diagnosisdate, surgerydate, RDI_carbo_neo, RDI_pacli_neo, RDI_carbo_adj, RDI_pacli_adj BUT NOT therapy.  
Look at the Cox regression model before imputation.

### For Upfront Chemo
```{r imputation up Chemo}
data <- Frontline %>% 
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Chemo") %>% 
  select(patientid, month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status, 
         raceeth, diagnosisdate, surgerydate,
         ageatdx, stagecat, debulking, histology,
         RDI_carbo_neo, RDI_pacli_neo, 
         RDI_carbo_adj, RDI_pacli_adj
         # therapy
  )
nonimp_cox_model <-
  coxph(Surv(month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_neo + RDI_carbo_adj + raceeth + ageatdx + stagecat + debulking + histology,
        data = data)
# nonimp_cox_model

Hazard <- nelsonaalen(data, month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status)
dataset <- data.frame(data, Hazard)
```

<!-- Start imputation to look at matrix -->
```{r}
Cox.imp <- mice(dataset, m=1, maxit=0, seed=123, printFlag=F)
# summary(Cox.imp)
Pred <- Cox.imp$predictorMatrix
# Pred["debulking", "month_at_os_from_treatment"] <- 0
# Pred
```

<!-- patientid is not used which is good. But SURGERYDATE IS NOT. -->
```{r}
Pred[, "surgerydate"] <- 1
Pred["surgerydate", "surgerydate"] <- 0
# Pred
```

<!-- Imputation and cox regression model on imputed data using the new predictor matrix. -->
```{r}
# Start imputations using mice
Cox.imp <- mice(dataset, m=5, maxit=50, 
                predictorMatrix=Pred,
                seed=123, printFlag=F)
check1 <- with(data = Cox.imp,
       exp = coxph(
         Surv(month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_neo + RDI_carbo_adj + raceeth + ageatdx + stagecat + debulking + histology
       ))
# pool(check1)$pooled
multiple_imputations_number <- round(max(pool(check1)$pooled$fmi),2)*100
```

Do m = `r multiple_imputations_number` (how to choose is explained in https://www.ebpi.uzh.ch/dam/jcr:dc0cef17-29c7-4e61-8d33-e690561ab7ae/mi_intro20191001.pdf depends of the fmi. The max fmi = `r multiple_imputations_number / 100` that we multiply by 100)
```{r}
Cox.imp <- mice(dataset, m= multiple_imputations_number, maxit=50, 
                predictorMatrix=Pred,
                seed=123, printFlag=F)

fit.Cox <-
  with(data = Cox.imp,
       exp = coxph(
         Surv(month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_neo + RDI_carbo_adj + raceeth + ageatdx + stagecat + debulking + histology
       ))

```

### For Upfront Surgery
Select the variables that may be important for predicting stagecat and debulking status:  
patientid, month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status, raceeth, ageatdx, stagecat, debulking, histology, diagnosisdate, surgerydate, RDI_carbo_adj, RDI_pacli_adj BUT NOT therapy.

```{r imputation up Surgery}
data <- Frontline %>% 
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Surgery") %>% 
  select(patientid, month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status, 
         raceeth, diagnosisdate, surgerydate,
         ageatdx, stagecat, debulking, histology,
         RDI_carbo_adj, RDI_pacli_adj
         # therapy
  )
nonimp_cox_model <-
  coxph(Surv(month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_adj + raceeth + ageatdx + stagecat + debulking + histology,
        data = data)
# nonimp_cox_model

Hazard <- nelsonaalen(data, month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status)
dataset <- data.frame(data, Hazard)
```

<!-- Start imputation to look at matrix -->
```{r}
Cox.imp <- mice(dataset, m=1, maxit=0, seed=123, printFlag=F)
# summary(Cox.imp)
Pred <- Cox.imp$predictorMatrix
```

```{r}
Pred[, "surgerydate"] <- 1
Pred["surgerydate", "surgerydate"] <- 0

```

<!-- Imputation and cox regression model on imputed data using the new predictor matrix. -->
```{r}
# Start imputations using mice
Cox.imp <- mice(dataset, m=5, maxit=50, 
                predictorMatrix=Pred,
                seed=123, printFlag=F)
check1 <- with(data = Cox.imp,
       exp = coxph(
         Surv(month_at_os_from_treatment, vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_adj + raceeth + ageatdx + stagecat + debulking + histology
       ))
# pool(check1)$pooled
multiple_imputations_number <- round(max(pool(check1)$pooled$fmi),2)*100
```

Do m = `r multiple_imputations_number` (The max fmi = `r multiple_imputations_number / 100` that we multiply by 100)
```{r}
Cox.imp <- mice(dataset, m= multiple_imputations_number, maxit=50,
```

# <span style="color:green">**Consort diagram**</span>

```{r consort, fig.width=12}
library(ggconsort)
study_cohorts <- 
  RDI_data_per_patients %>%
  cohort_start("**Assessed for eligibility**") %>%
  # Define cohorts using named expressions
  # Notice that you can use previously defined cohorts in subsequent steps
  cohort_define(
  flatiron_rec = .full %>% 
    filter(is.na(flatiron_rules)),
  
  study_criteria = flatiron_rec  %>% 
    filter(is.na(borderline)) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(histology)) %>%
    filter(!is.na(surgerydate)) %>%
    filter(had_carbo_pacli == "Yes") %>% 
    filter(treatment_sequence == "neo + surg + adj" |
             treatment_sequence == "surg + adj") %>%
    filter(is.na(line_keep)),
  
    missing_data = study_criteria  %>% 
    filter(!(issurgery == "Yes" & is.na(surgerydate))) %>%
    filter(is.na(gap_surg_drugs)) %>%
    filter(days_at_first_drug >= 0 &
             (is.na(surgerydate) | days_at_surg >= 0)) %>%
    filter((
      therapy == "Upfront Chemo" &
        (!is.na(RDI_carbo_neo) & 
           !is.na(RDI_carbo_adj)) 
    ) | (
      therapy == "Upfront Surgery" &
        (!is.na(RDI_carbo_adj))
    )
    ),
  
    standard_care = missing_data %>% 
    filter(is.na(neo_more_more_than_1line)) %>%
    filter(is.na(intravenous_rule)) %>% 
    filter(is.na(frontline_has_maintenance)) %>%
    filter(is.na(too_many_cycle)) %>% 
    filter(is.na(wrong_pacli_dosedense)) %>%
    filter(is.na(switch_drugs)),
  
    Frontline = standard_care,
  
  # anti_join is useful for counting exclusions
    excluded1 = anti_join(.full, flatiron_rec, by = "patientid"),
    excluded2 = anti_join(flatiron_rec, study_criteria, by = "patientid"),
    excluded3 = anti_join(study_criteria, missing_data, by = "patientid"),
    excluded4 = anti_join(missing_data, standard_care, by = "patientid")
  ) %>%
  # Provide text labels for cohorts
  cohort_label(
    excluded1 = "excluded albeit flatiron recommendation",
    excluded2 = "<span style='color:darkblue'>no study criteria</span>",
    excluded3 = "<span style='color:darkblue'>no missing_data</span>",
    excluded4 = "<span style='color:darkblue'>no standard_care</span>",
    flatiron_rec = "**Fit flatiron rec**",
    study_criteria = "**Fit study criteria**",
    missing_data = "**Non missing data**",
    Frontline = "**Population Study**"
  )

study_consort <- study_cohorts %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "full", 0, 40, cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, .full)
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "exc_flatiron_rec", 0.2, 35, glue::glue(
      "{cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, excluded1)}<br> 
      • <span style='color:darkgreen'>**90 days rule between diagnosis and treatment**</span> <br>
      • 30 days rule excluding patient who didn't survive <br> for at least 30 days after diagnosis
      ")
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "flatiron_rec", 0, 30, cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, flatiron_rec)
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "exc_study_criteria", 0.2, 25, glue::glue(
      "{cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, excluded2)}<br> 
      • Borderline cases (not invasive ovarian cancer) <br>
      • exclude patients whose histology is unknown <br>
      • remove chemotherapy only patients <br>
      • include patients who received carboplatin +/- taxane +/- Bev in a adj +/- neo settings
      ")
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "study_criteria", 0, 20, cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, study_criteria)
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "exc_missing_data", 0.2, 15, glue::glue(
      "{cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, excluded3)}<br> 
      • exclude the patients who had surgery but we don’t have a date of surgery -> NONE removed anymore <br> 
      • remove patients with long gap between surgery and adjuvant start (3 months) -> NONE removed anymore <br> 
      • exclude patients with a date of drug or date of surgery BEFORE diagnosis will be excluded (inclined to be wrongly recorded) <br> 
      • exclude patients for whose no RDI were available
      ")
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "missing_data", 0, 10, cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, missing_data)
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "exc_standard_care", 0.2, 5, glue::glue(
      "{cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, excluded4)}<br> 
      • exclude patients with more than 1 line as Neo <br> 
      • exclude patients with maintenance within their frontline <br> 
      • exclude patients with more than 6 cycles in Neo, more than 9 cycles total in upfront chemo or more than 9 cycles in upfront surgery
      ")
  ) %>%
  consort_box_add(
    "Frontline", 0, 0, cohort_count_adorn(study_cohorts, Frontline)
  ) %>%
  
  consort_arrow_add(
    end = "exc_flatiron_rec", end_side = "left", start_x = 0, start_y = 35
```

# II.Data analysis
## Explore the dataset
## <span style="color:green">**ICC between cycles**</span>

Used the ICC for a average raters, two-way mixed effects model with a measure for absolute agreement (two-way mixed-effects model and the absolute agreement are recommended for intra-rater reliability studies (Koo et al., 2016).  
<!-- **For ICC, a value of 0.9 is considered as excellent.**  -->
```{r ICC data prep}
# Need to recalculate the average per cycle as we did it by line (it was more simple and was coming back to same because we limit our study to 1+1 or 1+3 cycle type)
# What I did :
# Treatment <- Treatment %>% 
#   mutate(relative_dose_intensity = amount / expected_dose # adjusted_expected_dose
#   ) %>%
#   group_by(patientid, chemotherapy_type, drugname) %>%
#   mutate(mean_RDI_per_drug = round(mean(relative_dose_intensity, na.rm = TRUE), 3)
#   ) %>% 
#   ungroup()

Treatment_ICC <- 
  Treatment %>% 
  # Limit to the patietns after exclusion criteria
  filter(str_detect(patientid, paste(Frontline$patientid, collapse = "|"))) %>% 
  filter(linenumber_adj == 1) %>% 
  filter(had_carbo == "Yes") %>% 
  arrange(patientid, episodedate) %>% 
  # group to have RDI by cycle for each drug 
  group_by(patientid, chemotherapy_type, cycle_increment, drugname) %>%
  mutate(mean_RDI_per_cycledrug = round(mean(relative_dose_intensity, na.rm = TRUE), 3)
  ) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(patientid, episodedate) %>% 
  distinct(patientid, chemotherapy_type, cycle_increment, drugname, .keep_all = TRUE) %>% 
  filter(drugname == "carboplatin")
```

### Upfront Chemo Neo
```{r ICC}
ICC_df <- Treatment_ICC %>% 
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Chemo" & chemotherapy_type == "Neoadjuvant") %>% 
  select(patientid, cycle_increment, mean_RDI_per_cycledrug) %>% 
      pivot_wider(names_from = cycle_increment, values_from = mean_RDI_per_cycledrug) %>%
      select(-patientid)

icc_value <- ICC(ICC_df)$results[4, 2]
lb_value <- ICC(ICC_df)$results[4, 7]
up_value <- ICC(ICC_df)$results[4, 8]
# mutate(reliability = case_when(
#   value < 0.5 ~ "poor",
#   value >= 0.5 &
#     value < 0.75 ~ "moderate",
#   value >= 0.75 &
#     value < 0.9 ~ "good",
#   value >= 0.9 ~ "excellent"
# ))
```
The ICC value in Upfront Chemo Neo setting is equal to `r icc_value` which means that `r paste("the reliability is", ifelse(icc_value < 0.5, "poor", ifelse( icc_value <0.75, "moderate",ifelse(icc_value<0.9, "good", "excelent"))))`.  
Lower bound and higher bound are `r lb_value` - `r up_value` respectively.

```{r}
      pivot_wider(names_from = cycle_increment, values_from = mean_RDI_per_cycledrug) %>%
```

## <span style="color:green">**Table S0 Summary of the expected, actual dose, and RDI, Crcl, ...**</span>
Here we calculated the mean of amount, CrCl, BSA, height, weight, creatinine,
         target_auc, expected_dose, dose received, 
         RDI per patient/therapy/settings for each drug name.  
The tables show the median IQR for carboplatin calculated over patients with the same therapy (Upfront C or S) and setting (Neo or Adj).
```{r Summary of the expected, actual dose, and RDI}
tbl <- full_data_study_pop %>% 
  # Treatment %>% 
  # # Limit to the patietns after exclusion criteria
  # filter(str_detect(patientid, paste(Frontline$patientid, collapse = "|"))) %>% 
  # arrange(patientid, episodedate, drugname) %>% 
  # # group to have RDI by cycle for each drug 
  # # group_by(patientid, chemotherapy_type, cycle_increment, drugname) %>%
  # # mutate(mean_RDI_per_cycledrug = round(mean(relative_dose_intensity, na.rm = TRUE), 3)
  # # ) %>% 
  # # ungroup() %>% 
  # filter(drugname == "carboplatin") %>% 
  # filter(linenumber_adj == 1) %>% 

  group_by(patientid, therapy, chemotherapy_type, drugname) %>% 
  summarise(amount = mean(amount, na.rm = TRUE), 
            BSA = mean(BSA), 
            height = mean(height), 
            weight = mean(weight), 
            creatinine = mean(creatinine),
            CrCl = mean(CrCl),
            target_auc = mean(target_auc),
            expected_dose = mean(expected_dose),
            relative_dose_intensity = mean(mean_RDI_per_drug)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  mutate(chemotherapy_type = factor(chemotherapy_type, levels = c("Neoadjuvant", "Adjuvant")))

tbl %>% filter(drugname == "carboplatin" & therapy == "Upfront Chemo") %>% 
  select(amount, CrCl, BSA, height, weight, creatinine,
         target_auc, expected_dose, "dose received" = amount, 
         "RDI" = relative_dose_intensity, chemotherapy_type) %>% 
  tbl_summary(by = chemotherapy_type) %>% bold_labels() %>%
  modify_caption("**Upfront Chemo**")

tbl %>% filter(drugname == "carboplatin" & therapy == "Upfront Surgery") %>% 
  select(amount, CrCl, BSA, height, weight, creatinine,
         target_auc, expected_dose, "dose received" = amount, 
         "RDI" = relative_dose_intensity) %>% 
  tbl_summary() %>% bold_labels() %>%
  modify_caption("**Upfront Surgery**")
```

```{r ggridges, fig.width=16, fig.height=18}
Frontline %>%

               values_to = "RDI") %>% 
  filter(!is.na(RDI)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(y=bmi_cat, x=RDI,  fill=bmi_cat
             )) +
    geom_density_ridges(alpha=0.5) +

  geom_vline(xintercept = 1, color = "red", linetype = 2)+
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0.85, color = "blue", linetype = 2)+

  facet_wrap(therapy ~ name, ncol = 1)
```

# IV.Hazard Ratio
## Multivariable
## Adjusted by other drug
## <span style="color:green">**Table 3 HR Multivariable**</span>  

`RDI_carbo_neo_grp + RDI_carbo_adj_grp + raceeth + ageatdx + imp_stagecat + histology + imp_debulking`
```{r}
tbl2 <- Frontline %>%
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Chemo")
tbl21 <- 
  coxph(Surv(time = tbl2$month_at_os_from_treatment, 
             event = tbl2$vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_neo_grp + RDI_carbo_adj_grp + raceeth + ageatdx + imp_stagecat + histology + imp_debulking, 
        data =  tbl2) %>%
  tbl_regression(exponentiate = TRUE) %>% 
  bold_p(t = .05) %>% add_nevent(location = "level") %>% add_n(location = "level")
tbl3 <- Frontline %>%
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Surgery")
tbl31 <- 
  coxph(Surv(time = tbl3$month_at_os_from_treatment, 
             event = tbl3$vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_adj_grp + raceeth + ageatdx + 
          strata(imp_stagecat) + strata(histology) + imp_debulking, 
        data =  tbl3) %>%
  tbl_regression(exponentiate = TRUE) %>% 
  bold_p(t = .05) %>% add_nevent(location = "level") %>% add_n(location = "level")
tbl_stack(list(tbl21, tbl31),
          group_header = c("Upfront Chemo", "Upfront Surgery")) %>%
  bold_labels() %>%
  italicize_levels()
```

## HR
### Imputed data
`RDI_carbo_neo_grp + RDI_carbo_adj_grp + raceeth + ageatdx + imp_stagecat + imp_debulking`
```{r}
tbl2 <- serous %>%
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Chemo")
tbl21 <- 
  coxph(Surv(time = tbl2$month_at_os_from_treatment, 
             event = tbl2$vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_neo_grp + RDI_carbo_adj_grp + raceeth + ageatdx + imp_stagecat + imp_debulking, 
        data =  tbl2) %>%
  tbl_regression(exponentiate = TRUE) %>% 
  bold_p(t = .05) %>% add_nevent(location = "level") %>% add_n(location = "level")
tbl3 <- serous %>%
  filter(therapy == "Upfront Surgery")
tbl31 <- 
  coxph(Surv(time = tbl3$month_at_os_from_treatment, 
             event = tbl3$vital_status) ~ RDI_carbo_adj_grp + raceeth + ageatdx + 
          strata(imp_stagecat) + imp_debulking, 
        data =  tbl3) %>%
  tbl_regression(exponentiate = TRUE) %>% 
  bold_p(t = .05) %>% add_nevent(location = "level") %>% add_n(location = "level")
tbl_stack(list(tbl21, tbl31),
          group_header = c("Upfront Chemo", "Upfront Surgery")) %>%
  bold_labels() %>%
  italicize_levels()
```
